AppDefinition.name: AppDefinition
AppDefinition.description: Represents the metadata of an app and its navigation items. Metadata is returned only for apps that the current user can access.

Description.description: The optional description of the application.

DeveloperName.description: The developer name of the application.

DurableId.description: A unique virtual Salesforce ID for the application.

HeaderColor.description: The header color in the application. Specify the color with a hexadecimal code, such as #0000FF for blue.

IsLargeFormFactorSupported.description: Indicates whether the Large form factor is set in the CustomApplication metadata.

IsMediumFormFactorSupported.description: Indicates whether the Medium form factor is set in the CustomApplication metadata.

IsNavAutoTempTabsDisabled.description: Indicates whether the navigation automatically creates temporary tabs settings.

IsNavPersonalizationDisabled.description: Indicates whether navigation personalization is disabled.

IsNavTabPersistenceDisabled.description: Indicates whether workspace tabs are cleared for each new console session.

IsOmniPinnedViewEnabled.description: Indicates whether the Omni-Channel component is enabled in sidebar view. The default is false.

IsOverrideOrgTheme.description: Indicates whether to override the global theme for the org. When true, the color scheme and logo that the user has set are used. When false, the global theme for the org is used, even if the user has set a color scheme and logo.

IsSmallFormFactorSupported.description: Indicates whether the Small form factor is set in the CustomApplication metadata.

Label.description: The localized label value corresponding to the MasterLabel field.

LogoUrl.description: The logo URL of the application as selected by the admin.

MasterLabel.description: The non-translated label entered when the application was created.

NavType.description: The type of navigation for the application. The value Standard is for Lightning Experience. The value Console is for Salesforce console. A null value is for Salesforce Classic.

UiType.description: Indicates the type of custom application. The value Aloha is for Salesforce Classic, and Lightning is for Lightning Experience.

UtilityBar.description: The ID of the utility bar associated with this application.
